intro: Manettia pisifera, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false custardapple, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with white or pale pink petals, followed by fruit that resembles a small, round apple. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine. It is also noted for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats, contributing to its widespread distribution.
